SENT.plain: A 4-year-old boy presented with Goldenhar's syndrome, Duane's syndrome and bilateral papilledema
Magnetic resonance imaging of the brain was unremarkable
On lumbar puncture, the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure measured 36 cm H(2)O
The diagnosis of pseudotumor cerebri was made, and treatment with acetazolamide was started
As the papilledema did not resolve, steroids were added to the treatment
Lumbar puncture was repeated after 1 month, and pressure was found to be 30 cm H(2)O
Because medical treatment was not effective in lowering the CSF pressure, optic nerve sheath fenestration was performed
Papilledema resolved over the next 2 months
To the best of our knowledge, this is the first case of Goldenhar's syndrome associated with pseudotumor cerebri
